title-group.article-title: Performance of 1.0% and 1.45% Ash â€“ SAE 15W-40 Oils in On-Highway Trucks With Cummins, Caterpillar, and Mack Engines

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1989 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: The performances of 1.0% and 1.45% ash, SAE 15W-40--CE/SF oils were compared in on-highway trucks with Cummins, Caterpillar, and Mack engines. This field test was unique in that all the engines were new and premeasured by the OEMs. It was found that 1.0% ash oils provided: (1) wear control equal to 1.45% ash oils and (2) oil consumption control better or equal to 1.45% ash oils. The 300,000-mile (482,803-km) field test demonstrated that mixed diesel engine fleets can get maximum engine life to overhaul using a high quality, CE/SF, 1.0% ash-SAE 15W-40 oil.
